docs.lead_paragraph: SMITH--Margaret D., M.D. Mutual of America and its Board of Directors, together with all of its officers and employees, mourn the passing of Dr. Margaret D. Smith. Dr. "Maggie" Smith has served for over ten years as Mutual of America's medical consultant. Her extraordinary kindness and professionalism have been a great benefit to the health and well-being of our employees. Our sincere condolences to her husband, Dr. Matthew J. Ferguson, their children and families. Thomas J. Moran Chairman of the Board, President and CEO Mutual of America Life Insurance Company

docs.lead_paragraph: A proposal for five-day service by the post office, which also wants to raise rates, faces hearings on July 12.

headline.seo: Dissension Over Ending Saturday Mail Delivery
headline.main: Sides Form Over Threat to Saturday Mail Service
headline.print_headline: Sides Form Over Threat To Saturday Mail Service

docs.snippet: A proposal for five-day service by the post office, which also wants to raise rates, faces hearings on July 12.

docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON -- As federal regulators consider a proposal to cut most Saturday postal deliveries, the business community is sharply divided about the consequences of switching to five-day service. Some, like Donald J. Hall Jr., chief executive of Hallmark Cards, said that eliminating Saturday delivery and raising prices even incrementally would drive more business away from the United States Postal Service, resulting in a ''slippery slope.''

headline.main: Sides Form Over Threat To Saturday Mail Service

docs.abstract: Business community is sharply divided over proposal to cut most Saturday postal deliveries; some executives say replacing current delivery schedule with five-day service would be slippery slope and drive business away from United States Postal Service; others say switch is better than alternative of significantly higher postage rates that would inhibit growth of companies that rely heavily on mailings; Postal Service estimates that cutting Saturday delivery could save $3 billion a year; photos (M)
